title: Dolly Parton reveals 9 to 5 sequel has been dropped after script troubles
text:
She announced she intended to make a sequel to the hit comedy film, 9 to 5, last year.

But now it looks like there isn't going to be a movie after all.

Dolly Parton, 73, told ET Online she and co-stars Lily Tomlin, 80, and Jane Fonda, 81, have 'dropped that whole idea' after encountering roadblocks writing the script.

Bad news for 9 to 5 fans: Dolly Parton revealed she and co-stars Lily Tomlin and Jane Fonda decided not to move forward with the much-hyped sequel after encountering roadblocks writing the script (pictured at the premiere of Dolly Parton's Heartstrings)

'I don't think we're going to do the sequel,' Dolly told the outlet at the premiere of her Netflix series, Dolly Parton's Heartstrings. 'We never could get the script where it was enough different than the first one, and that one turned out so good.'

The sequel to the hit 1980 film was set to focus on women in the workplace, a particularly powerful topic amid the current Me Too era.

In the original film, Dolly, Lily, and Jane all played three employees who abduct their sexist boss and end up taking over the firm.

Though a sequel may no longer be in the works, the trio are considering working together on a completely different project.

Let's do this: In the original film, Dolly, Lily, and Jane all played three employees who abduct their sexist boss and end up taking over the firm

Getting this show on the road: It emerged last year that a sequel to 9 to 5 was in the works

'We're thinking we might do a completely different thing together, Jane, Lily and I,' Dolly said.

It emerged last year that a sequel to 9 to 5 was in the works.

The film would star the original three stars, but Jane would also executive produce and Lily would collaborate with writers.

What a way to make a livin'! The catchy theme song sang by Dolly for the film, 9 to 5, is still beloved today

Talking about the film, Dolly told the Mirror: 'Personally, I’ve been waiting for a 9 to 5 reunion ever since we did the first one.'

The catchy theme song sang by Dolly for the film, 9 to 5, is still beloved today.

9 to 5 was even adapted into a musical of the same name, and is currently playing at the Savoy Theater in London with David Hasselhoff recently joining the cast.
description: Dolly Parton revealed she and co-stars Lily Tomlin and Jane Fonda decided not to move forward with the much-hyped sequel after encountering roadblocks writing the script.
